intro: Marlea densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered marlea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Marlea densiflora is adapted to arid conditions and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy species for xeriscaping.
